The purpose of revealing the evil deeds of their ancestors again is to touch their hearts, so that they can assess the true reality and acknowledge the truth of the Qur'an revealed to Prophet Muhammad.

Allah calls on the polytheists to accept the teachings of the revelation that Allah conveyed to Muhammad. The book contains teachings that reveal secrets, which are unknown to themselves and to their ancestors.

Allah commands Prophet Muhammad to declare to the Jews that their statement that Allah did not send down a book to mankind is untrue, and commands him to ask them, who sent down the Torah to Musa. This firm statement is a challenge to their words.

At the end of this verse, Allah commands His Messenger that after they have received explanations that have proven their truth, but they still do not want to realize and do not want to believe in the truth of the Qur'an, to leave them in error, swallowed up by the currents of falsehood and disbelief.
text.92:
Allah explains that the Qur'an is a noble book, revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, the seal of the prophets. This book descended from Allah just as the Torah was revealed to Moses, except that the Qur'an possesses more perfect values because the Qur'an is eternally valid for all time. The Qur'an, besides being a guide, also serves as a confirmer of the books revealed previously in matters of monotheism, eliminating polytheism, and containing the fundamental teachings of *shara'* law that are eternal and unchanging throughout time.

The Qur'an is also a guide for the Messenger of Allah to warn his people, both those in Mecca and around the city of Mecca, that is, people in all corners of the world. The meaning of people around the city of Mecca and people in all corners of the world is in accordance with the linguistic understanding affirmed by Allah:

"And this Qur'an has been revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches." (al-An'am/6: 19)

Also the word of Allah:

"Say, [O Muhammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all..." (al-A'raf/7: 158)

The Prophet said:

"Every prophet was sent only to his own people, while I was sent to all of mankind." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Jabir bin Abdullah)

Allah explains that those who believe in the occurrence of the Day of Judgment and life in the hereafter will certainly believe in the Qur'an, because those who believe in the afterlife also believe in the consequences received on that day. That is why they are always looking for guidance that can save them in the hereafter. This guidance is found in the Qur'an, so they will certainly believe in the Qur'an, believe in the Messenger of Allah who received the book, obey Allah's commands, and perform *salat* on time continuously.

*Salat* is mentioned in this verse because *salat* is the pillar of religion and the essence of all worship. A person who performs *salat* in the best possible way is a sign that he likes to perform other acts of worship and can control his desires so as not to commit Allah's prohibitions.

In this verse, there is a firm insinuation regarding the denial of the people of Mecca and people who have attitudes like them towards the Qur'an; and it explains that they do not want to accept Islam and the prophethood of Muhammad because they do not believe in the afterlife. They feel that life only happens in this world.
text.93:
Allah explains to the Muslims that there is no one more unjust than the Jews who deny the truth of the Qur'an revealed to Muhammad. Their words have betrayed the teachings of the religion of monotheism. Likewise, their claims to receive revelation from Allah, like Musailamah al-Kadzdzab in Yamamah, al-Aswad al-'Ansi in Yemen, Thulaihah al-Asadi from Bani Asad, and those who claim to be able to create a book like the Qur'an.

This verse of Allah contains a subtle insinuation for the Jewish priests who are idolized by their followers because they claim to receive revelation from Allah that can be used to resolve anything difficult to understand from the Torah. In reality, they are the ones who are always hostile to Muhammad. The Qur'an also contains an insinuation to Arab writers who feel capable of composing books that can match the Qur'an, as in Allah's saying:

¦ if we willed, we could recite [something] like this. (al-Anfal)/8: 31)

Allah mentions the threat and punishment that will be received by those unjust people, when they breathe their last breath, as a reward for the crimes and sins they committed. How terrible it would be if the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims saw the suffering endured by those evil people at the time they face sakaratul maut, that is, the suffering they will experience before death, the awfulness of which is indescribable. At that time, the angel of death extends his hand to snatch their souls steeped in sin, with a harsh snatch.

Allah describes those terrible moments with a tone of reproach. The angel seems to say, "If you really feel capable, release your soul from your body to avoid this snatch." This command they will not be able to do, because this matter is beyond their ability. At that time, they cannot avoid painful and humiliating punishment, because they have dared to distort the truth, tell lies, and their arrogant and haughty attitude towards the verses of Allah, such as their saying that they are able to reveal a book like the Qur'an.

In this verse, there is a clear comparison between their inability to create a book like the Qur'an and their inability to avoid the angel of death. The intention is so that they can realize that what they say is actually just a lie, while the Qur'an comes from Allah to Muhammad, which cannot be matched by anyone.
text.94:
Allah explains the fate of the wrongdoers on the Day of Judgment. They will come before Allah individually, without bringing possessions, children, or rank, detached from pride, support, and worldly positions. The idols they thought could provide intercession will be of no use whatsoever. Their condition will be as they were created the first time, when they were in their mothers' wombs, as explained in the hadith:

"O people, you will be gathered before Allah on the Plain of Assembly (Mahsyar) barefoot, naked, and uncircumcised, just as We began the first creation, so We will repeat it. This is a promise We have made, and We will certainly fulfill it." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Ibn 'Abbas)

They will leave behind in the world everything that Allah has bestowed upon them, which became their pride, namely possessions, children, wives, and positions that caused them to be arrogant and unwilling to believe in the Messengers. None of these can save them from Allah's punishment in the Hereafter.

Allah explains that He will not heed anything they consider capable of providing intercession; whether it be idols they associate with Allah or priests they consider as intermediaries who can connect their prayers to Allah. In short, on that day, intercession and ransom will not be heeded; each person will be responsible for their own deeds. On that day, each person will be separated from everything that was usually their pride in the world. Their hopes will be dashed because what they thought would happen never will. The intercession and ransom they thought would help them will not fulfill their expectations in the slightest.
text.95:
Allah explains that all life occurs because of the Creator of life, namely Allah. Allah propagates all kinds of plants from seeds of life, whether in the form of grains or seeds. This is realized in order to be easily understood by humans, according to their general knowledge; including all types of life that are scientifically classified as plants that reproduce by spores or by cell division, which can only be known by certain people. All of these reproduce according to the law of cause and effect that has been determined by Allah.

The scientific explanation of this verse is as follows: bringing forth the living from the dead and bringing forth the dead from the living, is the life cycle of all living organisms (often simply written as organisms), especially from higher-level creatures, such as humans, animals or plants. When talking about plants, the phrase 'bringing forth the living from the dead' indicates that the plant (which is alive) comes out of the seeds that are planted. These seeds can be 'considered something dead'. Because if it does not find suitable conditions, it remains a 'dead' object. Meanwhile, 'bringing forth the dead from the living' indicates that the seeds (which are dead) come out of or are produced by the plant (which is alive). The life cycle of an organism is a metabolic process that occurs in all living things; and is controlled by a complex gene system. This is the power or ayat of Allah.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that the One who created everything has the most perfect attributes, possessing unlimited power and high knowledge, namely Allah. Thus, only Allah should be worshiped, and should not be associated with others.

Allah rebukes the polytheists, why do they deviate from the true worship, namely deviating from the religion of *tauhid* towards the worship of gods other than Allah, even though if they wanted to pay attention to the events of the universe, they would surely know that their actions are incorrect.
text.96:
Allah commands mankind to pay attention to the rotation of time caused by the movement of celestial bodies, which operates according to the law of cause and effect. Allah invites mankind to observe the open nature that can be seen daily. Allah unveils the light of morning that erases the darkness of night. That light appears on the eastern horizon after sunrise, so the world appears brightly lit. They experience this situation at times when they carry out all kinds of activities for their livelihood. As the opposite of this atmosphere, Allah invites mankind to pay attention to the dark state of night. Allah created the night for rest after they are tired from working during the day. This situation is described as an atmosphere of tranquility. The alternating atmosphere between day and night is like a situation that has similarities with the cycle of life, so that they have a broader perspective on life. The scientific explanation is as follows:

The word *husbana* (calculation) in this verse is intended as a calendar calculation. In the history of human civilization, it has been proven that the sun and moon are used for calendar calculations. Calendars based on the 'movement and position of the sun in the earth's sky, or what is known as the Solar Calendar, have been carried out by Western civilizations (originating from Rome and Greece), India; while Jewish, Arab, Chinese, and also Indian civilizations use the Lunar Calendar, which is a calculation based on the 'movement and position of the moon in the earth's sky. In astronomy, the Solar Calendar is based on the earth's orbital path relative to the position of the sun, while the Lunar Calendar is based on the moon's orbital path relative to the earth and sun.

In the world of astronomy-astrophysics, the moon is also used in calculating the determination of the rotational dynamic stability of the earth. This proves that the existence of the moon is very necessary for the precession of the earth on its axis to be stable. The moon provides stability in a time dimension of 10-100 years, while Venus and Mars provide stability in a time dimension of 100-500 years. Meanwhile, the planets Jupiter and Saturn also contribute to the rotational dynamic stability of our earth, and also act as a shield for the earth against the scattering of meteors that will hit the earth.

Allah mentions the reasons that change the atmosphere of day into night, namely the sun that revolves according to predetermined times. As a comparison, it is mentioned that the moon appears bright at night. Both the sun and the moon revolve in space according to their orbits regularly and specifically.

Allah mentions the sun and moon because these two celestial bodies are the most prominent among other celestial bodies, which in general humans can easily understand when the sun and moon rise and when these celestial bodies set, with the intention that humans can understand that every life is preceded by nothingness and will return to nothingness as well. Regarding the benefits of the rotation of the sun and moon, Allah explains further with His word:

He is the One Who made the sun a radiant source and the moon a reflection of light, and He has ordained for it phases so you may know the number of years and calculation (of time). (Yunus/10: 5)

In this verse, Allah mentions three kinds of His blessings that can be enjoyed directly by humans, namely the blessings they obtain without effort; the blessing of morning light, the blessing of night tranquility, and the blessing of sunlight and moonlight so that humans can comprehensively understand Allah's comprehensive mercy for all His creatures. At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that this creation of very high value is Allah's provision in accordance with the vastness of His knowledge, the greatness of His power and the height of His wisdom.

Allah says:

Indeed, We have created everything in precise measure. (al-Qamar/54: 49)
text.97:
Allah explains the usefulness of other celestial bodies, namely celestial bodies other than the sun and moon, which are known as stars that are used by humans as indicators of time, seasons, and direction at night. Stars are used as time indicators by observing the rising and setting of groups of stars. As a time marker, it is taken as a guideline that on March 21st each year, the sun sets together with Aries at 6:00 PM (18:00). Subsequently, each star sets earlier than the sun by about 1 degree or 4 minutes.

What is meant by time-indicating stars here are fixed stars, namely stars that shine on their own and have fixed constellations; not moving stars (planets, *as-sayarat*) because these stars are always wandering among other star constellations. As an indicator of the season, it can be known from the position of the sun among the fixed stars (*manzie*). For ease of use, it can be seen at sunset. If the sun sets together with the constellation Hamal (Aries), it means that on March 21st, spring has begun to arrive, while if the sun sets together with Sarathan (Cancer), it is June 21st; summer has begun to arrive. If the sun sets together with the constellation Mizan (Libra), it means that on September 23rd; autumn begins to arrive; and if the sun sets together with the constellation Jadyu (Capricornus), it means that on December 22nd, winter has begun to arrive. These seasons apply to countries in the Northern Hemisphere, while for countries in the Southern Hemisphere, the opposite applies.

Stars as direction indicators that are commonly used are fixed stars outside *minthaqatul buruj* (Zodiac), namely the Southern Cross (*as-shalibul Januby Crux*) by drawing a straight line from gamma cruxis to alpha cruxis and intersecting the horizon. The point of intersection is the south point. The Big Dipper or Ursa Major (*ad-Dubbul Akbar, Ursa Mayor*) is by drawing a straight line from beta ursaayorise through alpha ursae majoris and intersecting the horizon. The point of intersection is north. Further scientific explanations about the benefits of stars are as follows:

Stars are used as guides in the darkness on land and at sea, meaning that stars can be used as navigation indicators in travel/exploration/sailing. In the history of human civilization, sailors from the Viking, Roman, Greek, Arab, Spanish, and Portuguese nations have used their knowledge of the position of constellations as navigation indicators in their long voyages. The Southern Cross constellation has been used by English sailors as a navigation indicator. In scientific language, navigation indicators that use or are based on the position of stars in the sky are called stellar navigation. Stellar navigation has also been used by land explorers to determine the direction of their journey.

In the modern world today, stellar navigation has also been used by spacecraft, such as the Space Shuttle: Columbia, Challenger, and Enterprise.

Another use of the stars is as an indicator of the *qibla* direction, the location of the city of Mecca is precisely south of the city of Medina.

Allah explains His power in creating the heavens, the earth and all that is in them and all kinds of life and the legal system that applies to them in detail. This explanation is intended to show that by examining the majesty of God's creation, the human mind becomes open to accepting the belief in the existence of the Creator of the heavens, the earth and all that is in them and the power that He possesses.

At the end of this verse, Allah mentions that the detailed explanation is addressed to people who have clean minds and are protected from the influences of lust, namely people who examine natural objects purely, apart from certain goals that lead to personal, group and nationalistic interests. People who examine natural objects purely are the ones who will be able to find the answer to the secret of the creation of the universe that leads to God Almighty.
text.98:
Allah invites mankind to reflect on the creation of themselves, that they were created by Allah from a single self. This explanation provides the understanding that all humans, consisting of various nations and tribes with diverse shapes and skin colors, originate from a single source, namely Adam and Eve. They were created by Allah from one type (from soil), as explained in His word:

"O mankind! Be mindful of your Lord, Who created you from a single soul, and from it He created its mate, and through both He spread countless men and women." (an-Nisa'/4: 1)

This explanation answers the mystery of human creation, which is widely discussed by scientists, and serves as a confirmation to humans that they should not glorify idols and stars, but should worship only their Creator, Allah, the One and Almighty; to be grateful for the blessings of Allah that have been bestowed upon them, so that they may live knowing and helping each other because they essentially have the same dignity and originate from the same type. Differences in nationality, ethnicity, shape, and skin color should not be a cause for hostility and hatred, but should be a cause for fostering brotherhood and gratitude for the blessings of Allah Almighty.

Then Allah explains the process of human reproduction, that the process of reproduction also occurs by the power of Allah. Humans are created from sperm and ovum. Sperm comes from men, while ovum comes from women. Sperm emitted from men fertilizes the ovum, which for some time resides in the woman's womb; after going through a certain process, a baby is born. From that moment on, the baby lives in this world until his death arrives, then returns to the afterlife.

This explanation is an expansion of the previous verses so that humans can get a more detailed explanation, that Allah's power not only applies to inanimate objects but also applies to living creatures. This can also be understood by people who like to understand.
text.99:
Allah explains the events of things that are the daily needs of humans, so that they can easily understand Allah's power, wisdom, and knowledge. Allah explains that it is Allah who sends down rain from the sky, which causes the growth of various types of plants consisting of various forms, kinds, and tastes. As Allah says:

... watered by the same water, but We make some of them excel others in taste. (ar-Ra'd/13: 4)

It is mentioned that rain falls from the sky according to their custom. "Sama" or sky is used for anything that is above; while what is meant by Sama in this verse is "Sahab" which means clouds as shown in Allah's word:

Have you seen the water that you drink? Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down? (al-Waqi'ah/56: 68-69)

Allah explains that water is the cause for the growth of all kinds of plants with diverse forms, types, and tastes, so that humans can know how great Allah's power is in regulating the life of plants. Humans who like to pay attention to the water cycle will be able to know how high Allah's laws are. His law applies constantly and continues without ceasing, until the appointed time arrives.

Then, the details of the diverse plants are also mentioned; among them are grasses that grow in clumps so that they look green. This type of plant produces fruit in the form of small grains that are gathered in a stalk such as wheat, barley, and rice. Another type of plant is the palm tree which produces fruit gathered in a bunch that hangs low so that it is easy to pick.

Another type of diverse plant is grapes, olives, and pomegranates. When these types of fruits are mentioned in succession, it is because each has similarities and differences, characteristics, shapes, and tastes, so that some are blackish and some are greenish; some have rather broad leaves, and some have rather small leaves; likewise, some taste sweet and some taste sour. In this regard, scientists say:

Living things have been explained by botanists, such as plants playing an important role in making the world habitable. Among their roles, plants clean the air for humans, keep the temperature relatively constant, and balance the proportion of gases in the atmosphere. Allah SWT has determined that humans and animals receive their food from what is produced by plants in their "green factory". This green factory, which botanists call chloroplasts, contains chlorophyll which in the Qur'an is referred to as al-khadhir (green material), where plants utilize the energy of sunlight and convert it into chemical energy which ultimately produces grains, fruits and other parts of the plant.

Plant cells, unlike human and animal cells, can convert solar energy into chemical energy and store it in nutrients in very special ways. This process, called photosynthesis, is not carried out by cells but by chloroplasts, organelles that give plants their green color. These small green organelles, which can only be observed with a microscope, are the only laboratories on earth capable of storing solar energy in organic matter.

Photosynthesis is a chemical process, which is formulated as follows:

6 H2O + 6 CO2 + Sunlight → C6 H12 O6 + 6 O2

That is, water and carbon dioxide with the help of solar energy produce sugar/glucose and oxygen.

According to American astronomer George Greenstein, chlorophyll is the molecule that carries out photosynthesis. The mechanism of photosynthesis begins with the absorption of sunlight by chlorophyll molecules. Photosynthesis varies according to the intensity and duration of the sunlight source, and its productivity is measured by the output of oxygen it produces.

The production made by plants is realized through a very complex chemical process. Thousands of chlorophyll pigments found in chloroplasts react to light in a very short time, about one thousandth of a second. The conversion of solar energy into chemical or electrical energy is a very modern breakthrough.

The very complex photosynthesis system is a mechanism deliberately designed by Allah SWT. An 'unparalleled factory' carried out in a small area unit on the leaf. The photosynthesis process with the role of chlorophyll and chloroplasts, is one of the kauniah verses, which shows that all living things were created by Allah, the Sustainer of the entire universe. Related verse: al-hajj/22: 5).

All of this is to show Allah's power in creating diverse plants.

Allah commands humans to pay attention to the diverse plants when they bear fruit, how the fruits emerge from their stems or branches, then bloom as flowers, after the fruit appears, finally becoming perfect (ripe) fruit.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that in the process of fertilization there are signs of Allah's power that are very carefully managed and His knowledge is high. These signs of Allah's power are evidence for those who believe. From these verses, it can be understood that human attention to all kinds of plants is only limited to the outward state as evidence of Allah's power, not to the point of revealing the secrets of Allah's power over the creation of plants.
text.100:
Allah explains that the polytheists make the jinn partners with Allah. It is said thus because, in reality, even though the polytheists worship idols, they fundamentally do so because they follow the whispers of the jinn and devils.

Allah says:

"They invoke nothing but female deities besides Him, and they invoke nothing but a rebellious devil, whom Allah has cursed. And the devil said, "I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion. And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allah." And whoever takes the devil as an ally instead of Allah has certainly sustained a clear loss." (an-Nisa'/4: 117-119)

Allah explains the error of their actions because they actually know that Allah is the One who created the jinn. That is why their actions are reproached. Allah's reproach of them is like the reproach of Ibrahim a.s. to his people.

Allah says:

"Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve, while Allah created you and that which you do?" (as-shaffat/37: 95-96)

Allah also reproaches their actions because they have lied by saying that Allah has sons and daughters. Their accusation that Allah has sons is like the accusations of the Jews and Christians.

Allah swt says:

"The Jews say, "Ezra is the son of Allah"; and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of Allah." (at-Taubah/9: 30)

While their accusation that Allah has daughters is explained in Allah's word:

"Then ask them, [O Muhammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons? Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?" Unquestionably, it is out of their [fabrications] that they say, "Allah has begotten." And indeed, they are liars." (as-shaffat/37: 149-152)

They hurl that accusation without having the slightest reason. In fact, their words show their own ignorance or merely following their desires.

At the end of this verse, Allah clears Himself from their accusations, that He is Holy and Exalted above the attributes they give, namely that Allah has no partners and no children.
text.101:
Allah explains that He is the Creator of the heavens and the earth. In the creation of the universe and all that is in it, He did not imitate any previous creations. He created from nothing into existence.

This means that Allah created it absolutely, without needing the help of energy or other objects. Therefore, how could He possibly have a son, as the polytheists presume? Whereas He does not need a wife who can bear children. Allah refutes the assumptions of the polytheists by providing rational reasons so that they can accept the truth. This explanation is a clarification of the previous verse, Allah clearing Himself from the accusations of the polytheists; while the subsequent explanations emphasize that their assumptions are unreasonable.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that He is the All-Knowing of everything. His knowledge is not limited by space and time. His knowledge is eternal and everlasting. This is a decree from Allah to strengthen the reasons presented earlier and to invalidate the inappropriate accusations of the polytheists.
text.102:
Allah explains to the polytheists that Allah possesses the attributes mentioned in the previous verse. That is truly the God whom they are obligated to worship. The One who created everything, there is no other god except Him, not the gods they created such as idols, or angels who are considered children of God; because all of them are creatures of Allah who are not worthy of being associated with Him.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that He is the guardian of all things, that is, He controls all affairs, managing the universe and its contents with His knowledge, wisdom, and power.
text.103:
Allah explains the essence and grandeur of Himself as an affirmation of His attributes that have been explained in the previous verse, namely that Allah is above all things. His Great Essence cannot be reached by human senses, because human senses are indeed created in a structure that is not ready to see His Essence. The reason is none other than that humans are created from matter, and their senses only capture matter through matter as well; while Allah is not matter. So it is only natural that He cannot be reached by human senses.

What is meant by Allah not being reachable by human senses is while humans are still alive in the world. Whereas on the Day of Judgment, believers will be able to see Allah.

The Prophet Muhammad said:

"Indeed, you will see your Lord on the Day of Judgment as you see the moon on a full moon night, and as you see the sun when the sky is clear." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Jarir, *Sahih al-Bukhari* IV: 283).

Allah says:

"Some faces that Day will be radiant, looking at their Lord." (al-Qiyamah/75: 22-23)

The possibility of seeing God on the Day of Judgment is specifically for believers, while for disbelievers, the possibility of seeing Allah is closed to them.

Allah says:

"No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned." (al-Muthaffifin/83: 15)

Allah affirms that He can see everything that can be seen, and His *basirah* (sight) can penetrate everything that exists, nothing is hidden from Him, both its form and its essence.

At the end of this verse, Allah reaffirms that His Essence is Most Subtle, impossible to be reached by human senses, let alone its essence, and Allah is All-Knowing of everything, no matter how subtle, nothing is hidden from His knowledge.

(104) Allah explains to the Muslims that signs of the truth and strong arguments have come to them from Him. Allah says:

"Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does it] against it." (Fussilat/41: 46. Also note al-Isra'/17: 7)

text.105:

text.106:
Allah commands the Prophet (saw) and his followers that in conveying the Islamic da'wah, they should adhere to the revelation, because that revelation is what can be used as guidance for themselves and their people. The purpose of the da'wah is to convey the kalimat tauhid, which is the absolute acknowledgment that there is no God but Him.

The kalimat tauhid must be absorbed with a sincere heart, practiced with full conviction, and made the highest goal of human life. Allah gives affirmation to the Prophet and his people to turn away from the deeds of the polytheists and not to force those who remain immersed in polytheism, and not to ignore the invitation to tauhid, and not to be discouraged by the accusations directed by the polytheists, namely that the revelation conveyed by the Prophet was learned from the Jews, because the truth shines brightly on its own when spoken with the tongue and implemented in the form of good deeds, while falsehood, even if shrouded in various attractive things, will eventually reveal its rottenness.
text.107:
It is explained that if Allah willed to make all of humanity believe in Him, then there would be no polytheists.

Within the human soul lies the potential to become a believer or a disbeliever, obedient or wicked. Humans have been given the right to choose (ikhtiyar). The potential within humans can develop according to their knowledge and deeds. When they are about to choose which action to take, two kinds of impulses struggle: the impulse to perform good deeds and the impulse to perform bad deeds. If humans choose actions by following the good impulse, they will surely see the light of truth. However, if they follow the bad impulses, they will surely be submerged in darkness. Allah affirms that the Prophet was not given the power to be their guardian. The Prophet only invites to goodness, so if they do not want to accept that invitation, because they follow the bad impulse, then surely they will not accept the invitation, and they will remain wallowing in falsehood.

At the end of this verse, Allah reinforces His explanation that the Prophet was not sent to manage them, meaning he was not given the power to be responsible for their actions. That is their own affair, because they have been given the right to choose to determine their own destiny.
text.108:
Regarding the reason for the revelation of this verse, it is narrated that at one time, Muslims were cursing idols, the objects of worship of the disbelievers, and then they were forbidden from cursing them. (Narrated by 'Abd ar-Razzaq from Qatadah).

Allah forbade the Muslims from cursing the idols worshipped by the polytheists to avoid the polytheists cursing Allah, because they are people who do not know the attributes of Allah and the names that should be used for Him. Thus, it could happen that they curse Allah with words that cause the anger of the believers. From this verse, it can be understood that if an action is used to bring about another action that is sinful, then it should be abandoned, and all actions that cause bad consequences are forbidden. This verse also alludes to the prohibition for Muslims from doing anything that causes the disbelievers to further distance themselves from the truth. Cursing idols is actually cursing inanimate objects. Therefore, cursing idols is not a sin in itself. However, because cursing idols causes the polytheists to feel offended and angry, which ultimately leads them to retaliate by cursing Allah, then that action is forbidden.

Allah provides an explanation that He has made every people consider their own actions good. This means that the measure of whether an action or habit is good or bad sometimes arises from human evaluation itself, whether it is an action or habit that is passed down from generation to generation or an action and habit that has just arisen, such as the feelings of the polytheists being offended when people curse their idols. This shows that the measure for judging whether an action or habit is good or bad is a matter of *ikhtiyari* (choice). However, in addition to that, Allah has given humans an instinct to judge actions and habits, whether those actions and habits are good or bad. Meanwhile, the tasks of the Messengers are to convey the revelation that guides and directs the instinct to develop properly on the right path so that they can judge actions and habits with correct judgment.

At the end of this verse, Allah provides an explanation that all humans will return to Allah after they die, that is, on the Day of Resurrection; because He is the true Lord and He will inform them of all the deeds they did in the world, and will give them a fitting reward.
text.109:
Muhammad bin Ka'ab said, "The Quraysh said to the Prophet saw, "O Muhammad, you narrate that Musa a.s. had a staff that he struck against a rock, and twelve springs gushed forth, Isa a.s. resurrected the dead, and the people of Thamud had a she-camel. So bring us some of those things, and we will believe you." The Messenger of Allah saw replied, "What do you want?" The Quraysh replied, "Turn Mount Safa into gold." The Messenger replied, "If I do that, will you believe in me?" They replied, "Yes, by Allah, we will all follow you." Then the Messenger of Allah saw prayed, and Jibril a.s. came and said, "If you want, Mount Safa can be turned into gold, but I am not commanded to bring a miracle, to be denied except that punishment be inflicted, or to be left so that some of them may repent." Then Allah revealed this verse.

Allah explains that the polytheists swore by the name of Allah with all sincerity that if the Prophet could bring a miracle as they hoped, they would surely believe that the verses received by the Prophet truly came from Allah and they would acknowledge that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. This shows that their denial of the verses of Allah had reached its peak. They were actually unable to understand the proofs of truth contained in the verses received by the Prophet, then they suggested that other signs of truth be revealed. This shows that they were only looking for problems to bring down the Prophet by asking for miracles to be revealed, even though these miracles are given based on Allah's permission and wisdom, not depending on someone's will and desire.

Allah commands the Prophet that indeed the verses come from Allah alone, so the power to reveal revelation is not in Muhammad's hands but in the hands of Allah, given according to His will.

Allah says:

"And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah." (ar-Ra'd/13: 38)

After that, Allah explained to the Muslims who hoped for a miracle to come to the Prophet, to fulfill the demands of the disbelievers, that even if a miracle were revealed according to their request, they would never believe. Therefore, Muslims do not need to pay attention to their demands.
text.110:
After that, Allah gave an explanation to the Muslims that they did not know that Allah is capable of turning the hearts and sight of the polytheists; so just as they did not believe before they asked for the miracle, so too would they not believe after the miracle came, because their hearts had been turned away from the truth.

Allah says:

And even if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued ascending therein, they would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic." (al-Hijr/15: 14-15)

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that Allah will allow them to indulge their hearts in disbelief and disobedience. Their hearts are enveloped in confusion and doubt regarding the verses they hear. They cannot distinguish between truth and deception. They are left in darkness and manifest error.
text.111:
In this verse, it is explained to the Muslims that even if Allah were pleased to send down angels to the polytheists so that they could see them with their own eyes and hear their words with their own ears about the angels' testimony that Muhammad is truly the messenger of Allah, and even if the dead were brought back to life and spoke to them about the truth of the Prophet Muhammad, and even if all things, whether in the form of the Qur'an's explanation of the truth of the Prophet and his miracles, were gathered and shown to them, they would not believe, as they stated in their oaths. They ask for these signs not to seek guidance towards faith, but for the purpose of hostility, so that whatever they witness they will always consider as magic. If Allah willed them to believe, surely their hearts would be open to believe in a sincere way. They do not know that faith does not need to be linked to seeing signs of truth, because it has become a general truth that faith is solely a gift from Allah Ta'ala. Even though the signs of the truth of the Prophet Muhammad have been shown to the polytheists, it is not a guarantee that they will truly believe, because the coming of faith is not by force, but because of sincerity of heart, grace, *taufiq* and *hidayah* from Allah SWT.

Furthermore, Allah explains that the character of the polytheists is not known by most Muslims, so they ask the Prophet Muhammad to show his miracles, with the hope that the disbelievers will believe. (Some *tafsir* scholars are of the opinion that what is meant by 'most people who do not know' are the disbelievers).
text.112:
According to Mujahid, Qatadah, and Hasan al-Bashri, among the jinn and humans are those who become devils (shayatin). This opinion is reinforced by Abu Dharr, who was asked by the Prophet Muhammad, "O Abu Dharr, have you sought protection from Allah from the evils of devils from jinn and humans?" Then Abu Dharr asked, "O Messenger of Allah, are there devils from humans?" The Prophet Muhammad replied, "Yes, indeed there are." What is meant here are humans who behave like devils, always inviting to evil and enmity.

This verse explains that the Muslims face the hostility of the polytheists. Thus, Allah has made for every Prophet enemies consisting of devils, both from the human and jinn kind.

Devils are enemies to the prophets and the scholars who are the inheritors of the prophets; also to every preacher who spreads the religion of Allah. Whenever a conflict arises, one will surely defeat the other, the strong will certainly destroy the weak, and it is *sunnatullah* (Allah's way) that the good ending and the final victory will certainly be on the side of the righteous. When heavy rain falls, there will be a flood, and it will produce a lot of foam on the surface of the water. If the wind blows, the foam will soon disappear, leaving only the water remaining on the earth. Likewise, life is full of struggles; and a fighter cannot maintain his position except with perseverance and patience. Similarly, the deeds accepted by Allah are only those deeds that are done well and sincerely. This is affirmed by Allah as follows:

Meaning:

Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such (trials) as came to those before you have not yet befallen you? They were afflicted with misery and hardship and were so shaken that the Messenger and those who believed with him said, "When will the help of Allah come?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near. (al-Baqarah/2: 214)

The devils who are enemies of the prophets try to whisper to those they tempt with beautiful enticements to deceive them, and to deceive their sight so that they unknowingly slip from the right path.

The trickery of the devil has been clearly proven in the event experienced by Prophet Adam and Siti Hawa (Eve). The devil swore gently and described to Adam that if Adam and his wife wanted to eat the *khuldi* fruit (the fruit of eternity), then he would remain in paradise forever. Likewise, the devil whispers to those who fall into committing immorality. The devil whispers that they should use the opportunity to live freely in this world, enjoying all the pleasures of life, because they do not need to fear Allah's punishment, because Allah is the Most Forgiving and Most Merciful.

If Allah had willed that the devils should not deceive humans, then the devils would not be able to do anything. But Allah gives humans the freedom to choose what they will do according to the guidance of their sound minds and to choose the path they will take, the right path or the wrong path. Therefore, the Prophet was commanded not to heed them, because later in the afterlife they must be held accountable for all their behavior during their time in the world. While the Prophet's only duty is to convey the message.
text.113: Satan whispers deceptive words to those he intends to mislead, so that they do not believe in the afterlife and are inclined to these whispers. They are then drawn to follow what is whispered. As for those who realize that every action must be accounted for, they will not be deceived by the whispers of Satan, even if those devils strive hard to influence them to do what is whispered.
text.114:
This verse explains that the Prophet Muhammad stated his position on Allah's laws in the form of a question, to further arouse attention. He said, "Should I seek a judge other than Allah to decide something, when Allah has revealed to me the Qur'an in detail, encompassing the fields of faith (akidah), worship (ibadah), Sharia laws, and others?"

In reality, the Qur'an is sufficient as clear proof of Muhammad's prophethood, because the Qur'an is not his own creation, but solely a revelation from Allah SWT. Because the Prophet Muhammad had lived and associated with his people for about 40 years before he was appointed as a Prophet, and never during that time did the Prophet convey information about the unseen realm (alam gaib) and about the stories of previous messengers. The polytheistic Quraysh demanded that the Prophet Muhammad bring a miracle as proof of his truthfulness, even though they had been shown the greatest miracle, namely the Qur'an, which contains knowledge, with a word structure that cannot be imitated by anyone. This is sufficient proof that Allah has strengthened his prophethood, not only by revealing the Qur'an and the explanation within it about his position as a Prophet, but also with the information in the Torah and the Gospel (Injil), because both books contain information indicating that Muhammad is a Prophet and Messenger. Therefore, Allah commands that Muslims should never doubt the truth of the Qur'an.

The Jews and Christians who read the Torah and the Gospel (Injil) have recognized the Prophet Muhammad as they recognize their own children, but they conceal the truth and refuse to accept it, because, as informed in the Qur'an, they are envious of the Prophet Muhammad.
text.115:
The verses of the Qur'an containing truth and justice are perfect. These verses include Allah's promise to help Muhammad and his followers, so that they may achieve victory and glory; the Qur'an also threatens those who mock the Qur'an, that they will be humiliated and destroyed. Allah says:

"And Our word has already gone forth to Our servants, the messengers, that they will surely be the victors. And indeed, Our soldiers will be the triumphant ones." (ash-Shaffat/37: 171-173)

These verses are perfect because they are in accordance with the facts and realities that can be witnessed in the history of the prophets' victories, and the destruction of their enemies. No one can change the words of Allah. Allah's promise cannot be changed, and Allah will surely grant help to the messengers and their followers. Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing of all the words of those who betray, and He knows the contents of their hearts and all the sins they commit.
text.116:
If the Muslims were to always follow the desires of non-Muslims, they would surely succeed in leading the Muslims astray from the path of Allah. Therefore, Allah strongly forbids following laws other than those He has revealed. This prohibition is reinforced by the fact that the polytheists only follow conjecture in their beliefs. They only follow their desires, and always lie to Allah. They also permit carrion and animals sacrificed to idols.

History proves that the emergence of misguidance in most of humanity is because they follow their desires and conjectures. The People of the Book have abandoned the guidance of their prophets and strayed far from the truth. Likewise, the idol worshippers have strayed far from the guidance of their prophets. Prophet Muhammad was informed by Allah about the condition of those previous communities, and this proves his truthfulness as a Messenger.
text.117: Indeed, it is Allah who has guided Muhammad and revealed revelation to him. Allah absolutely knows who has strayed from His path and who are those who have obtained His guidance. Therefore, Muslims are obligated to be guided by the laws that have been explained in the Qur'an and to distance themselves from all kinds of deviations and actions that contradict the laws of Allah, because following the desires of those who are astray who have been enslaved by their own desires, so that they no longer know what is right and what is wrong, what is good and what is bad.
text.118: The *Sabab Nuzul* (reason for revelation) of Surah al-An'am verses 118-121 is narrated in Sunan Abi Daud and at-Tirmidhi from Ibn 'Abbas, who said, "People came to the Messenger of Allah (saw) and said, "O Messenger of Allah, should we eat what we slaughter and not eat what Allah slaughters (carrion)?" Then the verse was revealed until the word of Allah..." In this verse, Allah permits the Muslims to eat the slaughtered animals over which the name of Allah has been mentioned when slaughtering, if they truly believe in the verses of Allah. The polytheists and other groups had made the slaughtering ceremony a ritual. They included the foundations of their beliefs in the slaughtering ceremony. They used to perform slaughtering to draw closer to their idols and to their leaders whom they deified. They liked to mention the names of the idols they praised when slaughtering animals, and this kind of act is *shirk* (associating partners with Allah). Every slaughter must be intended solely for the sake of Allah. Therefore, Muslims are forbidden to eat the slaughtered animals of the polytheists because it is clear that the slaughter leads to *shirk*.
text.119:
In this verse, Allah poses the question: what prevents the Muslims from eating lawful animals over which the name of Allah has been mentioned during slaughter? While Allah has already explained to them what is truly forbidden for them, as stated in His words:

Say, "I do not find within that which has been revealed to me anything forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or defiled food dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful." (al-An'am/6: 145)

However, Allah grants leniency to Muslims to eat forbidden foods if they are in a state of necessity. In Ushul Fiqh, there is a principle that states:

"Necessity permits what is forbidden."

The actions of the majority of people are indeed wrong and misleading in the way they perform slaughter, leading them to fall into acts of shirk and straying far from the correct creed, which is the belief in Tawhid brought by the prophets and messengers whom Allah sent to all of mankind.

Among the people of Prophet Noah were some righteous leaders. After their death, their followers erected statues to commemorate their services and to use them as good examples. Over time, the followers went too far, so they paid homage to the statues by slaughtering animals to be offered to the statues, and even sought blessings from the statues. This situation continued, generation after generation, and eventually spread to other communities, so that the intended homage turned into the belief that the statues deserved to be honored and worshiped.
text.120:
Allah forbids Muslims from committing sins, both those that are apparent in behavior and those that are hidden. Apparent sins are those committed by humans using their limbs, while hidden sins are those reflected in attitudes and other things that are not displayed (bad deeds that are concealed), such as arrogance, planning evil, and deception towards people. Allah states firmly that all sins must be abandoned, both apparent and hidden, and Allah gives a warning that whoever commits sin will be afflicted with severe punishment, as a result of the violations they have committed, deliberately and openly.

As for those who commit sins and evil deeds out of ignorance, then they stop by performing sincere repentance, then towards them, Allah will grant forgiveness and erase their sins, because they have done good deeds as proof of their repentance. Indeed, every good deed can eliminate evil deeds, as Allah says:

"Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds." (Hud/11: 114)
text.121:
The *Sabab Nuzul* (reason for revelation) of this verse is narrated by Abu Daud and al-Hakim from Ibn 'Abbas, stating that "people came to the Prophet saw, and they said: 'What Allah slaughters, you should not eat, but what you slaughter, that is what you eat'," then this verse was revealed.

Indeed, the devils, both jinn and humans, whisper to their friends to argue against the Muslims. Ikrimah said, "Devils from the Magians, after hearing that the Prophet Muhammad prohibited carrion, wrote to the Quraysh, who at that time often corresponded with the Magians. In the letter, they said, "Muhammad claims to be following the commands of Allah, but why does he consider what is slaughtered by humans to be halal, while what is slaughtered by Allah (carrion) is haram?" Then Allah revealed this verse.

Regarding eating the meat of animals upon which the name of Allah is mentioned when slaughtering them, there are several opinions among Islamic scholars. According to Imam Malik, all animals slaughtered without mentioning the name of Allah when slaughtering them are haram to eat. According to Imam Abu Hanifah, if the name of Allah is not mentioned intentionally, then it is haram to eat the meat of that animal, and if it is not mentioned due to forgetfulness, then it is halal to eat. According to Imam Syafi'i, all animals that are slaughtered without mentioning the name of Allah, whether intentionally or due to forgetfulness, then their meat is halal to eat, as long as the person who slaughtered them is a Muslim.

Thus, if the Muslims follow the desires of the polytheists regarding making carrion halal, then they will certainly be among the polytheists. This verse indicates that whoever makes halal something that Allah has made haram, or makes haram something that Allah has made halal, then they are among the polytheists, because by doing so they have established that there is a party entitled to create sharia besides Allah swt.
text.122:
The *Sabab Nuzul* (reason for revelation) of this verse is narrated by Abu al-Shaykh from Ibn 'Abbas regarding Allah's statement, he said that this verse was revealed concerning Umar and Abu Jahl.

In order to show the difference between the Muslims and the disbelievers, Allah poses a question: Is the one who was dead in heart due to disbelief and ignorance, then We gave life to his heart with faith, and We also gave him light, which is the clear and radiant Al-Qur'an, the same as the one who is in layers of darkness? He cannot escape from that darkness. He is surrounded by fear, weakness, and confusion. Likewise, a person who is in ignorance, blind imitation, and corruption of thought, cannot escape from that. He is afraid to leave his cave of misguidance and feels no need to come out into the clear guidance because his eyes are blinded by the light of that guidance.

Therefore, it is fitting for every Muslim to always seek and use knowledge in all things. He must know the truth of his religion with full conviction so that he is steadfast in performing good deeds, and can be a role model for those around him.

Thus, he will become a lighthouse reflecting strong conviction and a clear *hujjah* (proof), showing the excellence of his religion to the followers of other religions. That is how Allah has made the believers see good in the light of guidance and the religion that has given life to their hearts. Conversely, Allah has made the disbelievers see good in whatever they do, such as committing sins and transgressions, opposing the Messenger, sacrificing to other than Allah, and forbidding what Allah has not forbidden and permitting what He has forbidden, and so on. All of that they do is due to the deception of Satan who whispers enticements into their hearts. A clear example of a person who does not believe and rejects Allah's guidance is Abu Jahl.
text.123:
Some of the inhabitants of Mecca had gone astray due to the enticements of their leaders who committed various kinds of crimes and deceptions. In almost every country and major city, there were some corrupt and evil leaders who engaged in deception. It has become *sunnatullah* in society that whenever Allah sends a messenger to a place to guide them, there are always leaders who oppose that messenger and his followers. Whereas the messenger intends to bring about improvement and rectification. Often in several countries and major cities, a number of figures emerge who want to seize power and accumulate wealth in various ways. Their subordinates who do not agree with their leaders feel confused in carrying out their duties. They are unable to follow their corrupt and deviant leaders. In such a chaotic atmosphere, wisdom, strong faith, and high morale are needed, so that one is not easily swept away by the current of error that leads to the wrath of Allah.

What is meant by evil leaders are those who oppose the call of religion and are hostile to the messengers and their followers. Such was the state of Mecca when the Prophet Muhammad was sent. A similar situation continues to recur in other countries. Corrupt leaders are hostile to the messengers and their followers who convey religious teachings. In essence, they are merely deceivers, deceiving themselves, but they are not aware.

It has become *sunnatullah* that an evil deed will lead to misfortune. Every deception planned against Allah's righteous servants ultimately befalls the perpetrator. Many events in human history show that communities that opposed the messengers and their followers were eventually destroyed by Allah with various kinds of punishments, such as natural disasters, and others. They engaged in deception to oppose the improvement of human morals and ethics, driven by the desire to occupy high positions and follow the impulses of their desires. They did not realize that the consequences of their evil deeds would befall themselves, because they did not understand this *sunnatullah*.

In the verses above, Allah gives a warning to all rebellious leaders. Allah also motivates the Prophet Muhammad and his followers to continue doing good deeds because, in carrying out a sacred task, they must not heed the temptations and obstacles that arise from wherever they come.
text.124:
Ibn Mundhir narrated from Ibn Juraij and Abu Shaibah that this verse was revealed because a prominent figure in Mecca named Walid bin Mugirah said, "By Allah, if Muhammad's prophethood is true, then I am more entitled to be appointed as a prophet than Muhammad, because I have more wealth and descendants."

When verses of the Qur'an were revealed explaining the truth of Muhammad's prophethood and containing knowledge and guidance that he brought from Allah, they said, "We will not believe in Muhammad unless he brings a miracle like the one Allah gave to Prophet Musa, namely his staff that could split the sea, or like the miracle of Prophet Isa who could heal leprosy and bring the dead back to life."

Their even greater demands are mentioned in Allah's words:

"And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why are not the angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly thought too highly of themselves and transgressed with great transgression." (al-Furqan/25: 21)

Basically, they did not want to believe in the Prophet Muhammad unless he was given things similar to what was given to previous messengers. Allah refuted their demands and stated that only Allah absolutely knows to whom He entrusts the task of apostleship. Their demands are also explained by Allah Ta'ala in His words:

"And they say, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?" Is it they who would apportion the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world." (az-Zukhruf/43: 31-32)

Such demands were made by them to the Prophet Muhammad, linked to worldly life, driven by their envy and arrogance, and intended to refute the Prophet's position as the Messenger of Allah.

This is explained in Allah's words:

"And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not but in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who mentions [i.e., criticizes] your gods?" And they are, of the remembrance of the Most Merciful, disbelievers." (al-Anbiya'/21: 36)

The leaders of the Quraysh who insulted the Prophet Muhammad, in their hearts, actually acknowledged the nobility of his lineage, his honesty, and the greatness of his character, so they gave the Prophet the title Al-Amin (the trustworthy). They acknowledged that the Prophet Muhammad was worthy to be made a messenger of Allah. There was no other reason that prevented them from believing except for envy, arrogance, and blind imitation of the beliefs of their ancestors.

The position of apostleship is solely a gift from Allah bestowed upon whom He wills. The position of prophethood cannot be achieved through effort or by raising the level of education, nor can it be achieved through lineage or descent. This position is only given by Allah to those whom He chooses. Then Allah threatens the arrogant leaders of the Quraysh that they will be afflicted with humiliation in the sight of Allah and a painful punishment because of their evil deeds and their deception against the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims, as stated in His words:

"So Allah made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is far greater, if they only knew." (az-Zumar/39: 26)

The punishment from Allah is inflicted upon those who are disobedient, due to their sins and transgressions. Unfortunately, that punishment is seen by some people only as a natural disaster and does not create awareness in their hearts, as the punishment of God. Some of them died killed during the Battle of Badr, and some experienced a humiliating fate in life.
text.125:
If there is a person who is magnanimous and open-hearted to accept the truth of the Islamic religion, then that is because Allah intends to guide him. Therefore, his chest becomes open to accept all Islamic teachings, whether in the form of commands or prohibitions.

It is narrated that the Messenger of Allah was once asked about the "openness of the chest" referred to in this verse, and he replied, "That is a depiction of divine light that illuminates the heart of a believer, so that his chest becomes open." The companions asked again, "Are there any signs of that?" The Prophet (saw) replied, "There are signs, namely always inclining towards the hereafter, always distancing oneself from the deception of the world, and always preparing to face death." (Narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim from Abdullah bin Mas'ud)

If these are the characteristics of believers whose chests are open due to the light of faith entering their hearts, then conversely, those whom Allah wills to live in error, their chests are made tight and constricted as if they are ascending to the sky where there is no air. If they are invited to think about the truth and contemplate the signs of Allah's Oneness, then because of the arrogance in their hearts, they refuse because that action does not conform to their desires. The desire to follow the truth weakens, and every religious recommendation is felt as a heavy burden that they cannot bear. The image of such a person is like someone ascending to the sky. The higher he goes, the more breathless he becomes due to lack of oxygen, so he is forced to descend again to avoid destruction.

In this verse, Allah gives a parable, so that it is truly absorbed with a clear feeling. Thus, Allah places constriction in the hearts of those who do not believe, because disbelief is like dirt that covers their hearts, so that they do not accept the truth. This condition can be witnessed in their behavior in daily life, which always leads to evil.
text.126: This verse explains that the heart of a believer is always open and happy due to the straight teachings of Allah's religion brought by the Prophet Muhammad. The Islamic religion teaches a true *akidah* (system of belief) that brings happiness in this world and the hereafter. This is very clear because it is accompanied by real evidence and convincing explanations. The only straight path that is in accordance with reason and *fitrah* (natural disposition) and based on the eternal word of Allah, is the path that leads to Allah's pleasure, namely the strong rope of Allah. Allah has explained His verses for those who want to pay attention.
text.127: For those who tread the straight path, Darussalam (Paradise) is prepared in the presence of their Lord. They live following the guidance of the prophets who gave them direction, so they avoid crooked paths and ultimately arrive at Darussalam. Allah guides them and suffices the reward for every deed they performed in the world. Allah guides them during their life in the world and grants them *tawfiq* to perform good deeds, so they obtain its reward, and are permitted to enter His Paradise solely through His grace.
text.128:
On the Day of Judgment, all of humanity and jinn will be gathered in Padang Mahsyar (the Gathering Place), then Allah will say to them, rebuking the actions of the jinn who influenced humans and invited them to stray, as explained in Allah's words:

Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan? Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy. And that you worship Me? This is a straight path. And he had already misled a great multitude of you. Then did you not use reason? (Yasin/36: 60-62)

All those who followed the teachings of jinn and Satan will be gathered together. All those who are *mukallaf* (responsible for their actions) will be gathered with their followers, both in terms of truth and evil. Then those who were followers of the jinn will say in response to Allah, "Our Lord, we mutually benefited from each other. The jinn benefited because they succeeded in misleading us with temptations and following the desires of [our] lower selves, and conversely, we were pleased to follow them and listen to their whispers. We felt free to indulge in worldly pleasures."

In this verse, Allah gives guidance that every human being is always accompanied by Satan who tries to persuade him with whispers that invite him to wickedness and disobedience to Allah, so that he does not realize that it is a trick from Satan. These subtle creatures always try to mislead humans into the valley of falsehood and evil, just as germs always try to cause various diseases in the human or animal body. Germs know the way to enter the human or animal body through fine holes. Likewise, Satan knows the way to enter the human heart, so that humans fall into the valley of error without realizing it.

If a germ succeeds in sneaking into the human body and causing disease, then humans, who are more subtle in nature, can be influenced by subtle creatures, namely jinn and Satan, which can lead to spiritual diseases of humans.

Those who are followers of jinn and Satan say, with sadness and regret, "Our Lord, we have reached the time that You have determined for us, after we received worldly pleasures because of following the invitation of jinn and Satan, and we have acknowledged our sins, so we surrender ourselves to You to receive Your fairest punishment."

Their words show their regret and recklessness in following their desires, and now they surrender to Allah who knows all their actions. In this verse, it is not mentioned what the jinn's answer was and the reasons for Satan leading them to stray, but it is explained in other words of Allah which show that Satan, jinn, and humans who are victims of their incitement fight each other to release responsibility and curse each other:

"...then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers." (al-'Ankabut/29: 25)

As an answer to their complaints, Allah says, "The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except as Allah wills." Everything is under His will and choice, and no one knows His will except Him. He is the All-Wise and All-Knowing Lord.

Ibn 'Abbas understood the verse above, that no one should interfere in determining the fate of a servant of Allah, whether he will be admitted to Paradise or Hell. Everything is under the power and will of Allah.
text.129:
In this verse, it is emphasized that living in groups among people with the same goals, ideals, and interests, especially in matters that are evil and misleading, has become a habit of some living beings, with no difference between jinn and humans. They always help each other in various efforts to ensure their desires and efforts are fulfilled according to their plans. They do not hesitate to commit violence, injustice, and persecution, disregarding norms of humanity, justice, and compassion, as long as they can satisfy their desires in enjoying worldly life to the fullest. This can be proven from various events in history from ancient times until now. How many prophets and messengers of truth, callers to the creed of *tauhid* (oneness of God), faced great and harsh challenges from idol worshippers and defenders of falsehood and misguidance because the prophets and messengers remained steadfast in their stance, firm in their *dakwah* (propagation of faith), so that Allah punished their misguided and disobedient people, such as the people of 'Ad and Thamud. How many nations that felt strong and mighty openly seized the rights of weak nations without regard for justice and humanity. But the oppressed and colonized nations did not remain silent; they fought in various ways to regain their independence. Indeed, it has become *sunatullah* (Allah's law) that truth will surely prevail as long as it is defended and fought for.

Allah says:

And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is ever vanishing." (al-Isra'/17: 81)

Allah does not command humans or jinn to unite and group together to commit evil, do what is false, and commit what is *mungkar* (evil), but this is the nature of humans and society themselves; they are more interested in joining and helping groups with the same direction and purpose in life, even if it is intended to commit injustice and act arbitrarily towards other communities. Allah says:

The hypocrite men and women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and close their hands [from spending]. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them [accordingly]. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient. (at-Taubah/9: 67)

In interpreting this verse, Qatadah said, "Indeed, Allah makes people close friends because each has the same tendencies; a believer is a *wali* (close friend) to another believer, whenever and wherever he is. A disbeliever is a *wali* to another disbeliever, whenever and wherever he is. Faith is not just with wishful thinking and not just a symbol or sign. By Allah who owns my life! If you are obedient to Allah, and you do not know anyone among those who are obedient to Him, then it will not harm you. And if you commit disobedience and sins that Allah has forbidden, and you are close friends with those who are obedient and pious to Him, then it will not benefit you in the slightest."

Abu Syaikh narrated from Mansur bin Abi al-Aswad, he said, "I asked al-A'masy about the meaning of verse 129: 'What did you hear from the companions and *ulama tabi'in* (scholars of the successors)?'" Al-A'masy replied, "I heard them say, "If the morals of people have been corrupted, then they will be easily commanded by evil people." Allah says:

And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction. (al-Isra'/17: 16)

On the other hand, the believers unite and have leaders and confidants who consist of good, honest, and pious people to Allah.

Allah's word:

The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and establish prayer and give *zakat* and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise. (at-Taubah/9: 71)
text.130:
In the afterlife, all disobedient jinn and humans, who did not follow the teachings of the messengers and did not heed the prohibitions of Allah conveyed to them by the messengers, thus acting arbitrarily on earth, will be presented with the question, "Did not Our messengers come to you, warning you and giving you true guidance so that you would not go astray and not commit acts that contradict Our teachings?" They will be powerless to answer, and they will regret everything they did during their lives in the world, and with bowed heads they will acknowledge their mistakes, answering, "We acknowledge that the Messenger of Allah came to us and gave us warnings and good teachings that we should have heeded and followed obediently, but we did not heed them, we even denied them and mocked their calls."

Allah says:

"They will say, "Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied [him] and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'" (al-Mulk/67: 9)

They were deceived and deluded by the life of the world and they were blinded by wealth, women, rank, and position, so that their hearts became frozen, their eyes became blind, unable to distinguish between good and evil. They could no longer see the light of divine teachings that would lead them to happiness in this world and the hereafter. The messengers had recited to them the verses revealed by Allah and had warned them that in the afterlife there would be a Day of Reckoning where those who do good will enter Paradise and those who disbelieve will be punished in Hell. At that time, they will confess frankly that they were indeed disbelievers and infidels in the past (in the world), denying the messengers and not believing in the existence of the Hereafter.

Regarding the messengers who were sent, were they all human beings or were there also messengers from the jinn who were sent to their people? The majority of scholars are of the opinion that the messengers were all human beings, but were tasked with conveying the da'wah to both jinn and humans, and that there were no messengers from among the jinn. The Qur'an and authentic hadith indicate that the Prophet Muhammad was also sent to the jinn, as mentioned in the following verse:

And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a company of the jinn listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners. They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path." (al-Ahqaf/46: 29-30)
text.131:
In this verse, Allah has explained His sunnah and decrees in accordance with His wisdom and justice. When Allah intends to destroy a people due to their disobedience and oppression, He first sends a messenger to warn them. Allah will not send down His punishment and torment upon a people who are heedless and negligent before sending His messenger to them, one who provides guidance and direction, who will warn and awaken awareness in their hearts that they have truly strayed from the straight path and have committed reprehensible acts that contradict justice and humanity.

The punishment that Allah sends down upon His servants who are disobedient to the messenger who warns them, for example, destroying them as happened to the people of 'Ad and Thamud; or a humiliating punishment by expelling and scattering them, as suffered by the Children of Israel; there is also a punishment that destroys their strength, as suffered by the polytheists of Mecca. After the Prophet Muhammad was sent by Allah to all of mankind, the punishment of destruction and annihilation no longer exists. As for the disasters that occur, such as earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, and so on, they are trials and tests for mankind so that they may repent and be aware of Allah's power and so that they may always remember Him, and not turn away from the guidance and teachings that He has revealed through His messenger.

Allah will never oppress His servants, but they are the ones who oppress themselves by committing acts that contradict *sunnatullah* and violate the norms that He has given for the happiness of mankind in this world and the hereafter. There may be some people who appear strong and prosperous even though that people has turned away from the norms of justice and humanity, some even deny the power of Allah and consider religion as a poison that kills people. That is *istidraj* from Allah, allowing them to drown in materialism, arrogance, and pride over the results they have achieved. But in the end, they will experience the same fate as those who are arrogant and proud. It is up to man himself whether he will become a believer, obey and carry out all the rules and teachings that He has revealed through His messenger, so that he lives happily in body and soul, or whether he will consider himself more powerful or smarter and consider religious teachings to be outdated. Man is free to think, act, and determine something according to his will and will eventually be tossed about between theories that are constantly changing and have no definite beginning or end, and fall into the abyss of destruction, chaos, and damage. Allah has laid out before man the good path and the bad path; it is left to man to choose which path he will take.
text.132:
In this verse, Allah explains that each jinn and human who has received the call of the messenger will receive degrees and levels according to their deeds. Those who believe, are pious, and do good deeds will receive degrees and levels according to the strength of their faith, the strength of their piety, and the abundance of good deeds they perform, such as the degrees of the prophets, the *shiddiqin* (those who are truthful in their beliefs in their lives), the *syuhada'* (martyrs and heroes), and the *shalihin* (righteous people), as mentioned in Allah's word:

"And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger (Muhammad) - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor - of the prophets, the *shiddiqin*, the martyrs, and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions." (an-Nisa'/4: 69)

Conversely, those who are disbelievers, hypocrites, and deniers who commit many evils will occupy the lowest level, according to their respective efforts and deeds; such as the hypocrites whose place is in the lowest level of Hell, as stated in Allah's word:

"Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper." (an-Nisa'/4: 145)

Allah is never unaware of what the jinn and humans do. All their deeds, whether small or large, bad or good, will be recorded, and they will receive their recompense. Evil will be repaid with a commensurate punishment, and good will be rewarded with multiplied rewards.
text.133:
This verse affirms that Allah is the All-Sufficient and the Most Vast in His mercy, and He does not need anything or anyone; but everything other than Allah needs His help and assistance, both in its existence and in its life. No matter how much wealth a person has, he still needs the help of others, for example, the help of his servants, laborers, doctors, and so on. He will certainly still need the help of Allah, his Creator and the Creator of all his needs and necessities of life. Allah says:

"O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy." (Fathir/35: 15)

This is explained by a Qudsi hadith narrated by Abu Dharr from the Prophet saw; he received revelation from God as follows:

Translation:

"O My servants, I have forbidden injustice for Myself, and I have made it forbidden among you, so do not wrong one another. O My servants, all of you are astray except those whom I have guided, so ask Me for guidance and I will guide you. O My servants, all of you are hungry except those whom I have fed, so ask Me for food and I will feed you. O My servants, all of you are naked except those whom I have clothed, so ask Me for clothing and I will clothe you.
